<p>Nous recrutons un\u002Fe responsable administratif d'entreprise pour l'une de nos entreprises, ATEXIA Système basée à La Possession (Réunion).<\u002Fp>\n <p> Le\u002Fla Responsable Administratif d’Entreprise est le\u002Fla garant\u002Fe du fonctionnement administratif et comptable de l’Entreprise dans un environnement opérationnel faisant appel à des expertises métiers et le goût pour le travail en équipe. Sous l’autorité du Chef d’Entreprise, il\u002Felle est son véritable bras droit pour l’ensemble de ses missions dans le respect des processus de l’Entreprise, en lien fonctionnel au RAF de la société, et dans les valeurs du Groupe VINCI.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vous prendrez en charge :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>La réalisation de la comptabilité analytique et du suivi financier d’affaires ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>L’élaboration du budget de l’entreprise en collaboration avec le Chef d’entreprise ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Le suivi analytique des affaires, en assurant la revue d'affaires avec les Responsables d'Affaires et la Chef d'Entreprise (contrôle de gestion opérationnel) ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>L’analyse des frais généraux et autres écarts ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>L’établissement et l’analyse des arrêtés de comptes de l’entreprise mensuels et trimestriels ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Le reporting des indicateurs analytiques dans les applications du groupe VINCI Energies ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>La supervision de la facturation clients et des impayés ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>La supervision de la comptabilité fournisseurs<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Par ailleurs, vous aurez en charge une partie de la gestion du personnel, en relais du service RH (et notamment, le suivi des intérimaires, gestion administrative de la formation, planification des formations…)<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> De formation supérieure en comptabilité ou gestion (DCG, MASTER compta\u002Fgestion, école de commerce), vous disposez d'une expérience réussie de 5 ans dans un poste similaire au sein d'un groupe ou en cabinet d'expertise.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Dynamique, rigoureux et autonome, vous connaissez parfaitement le pack Office et idéalement les outils informatiques du Groupe (SAP, Quartz, Codex...). Vous êtes force de proposition dans l’analyse et les procédures à mettre en place. Aussi, vous avez le sens des responsabilités, un bon relationnel pour dialoguer avec les opérationnels et vous souhaitez vous investir pour seconder efficacement le chef d'entreprise de cette filiale.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Ce poste, requiert de l'autonomie, de l'organisation et un bon sens relationnel pour un travail en équipe.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Connexion, performance, efficience énergétique, datas : dans un monde en évolution permanente, VINCI Energies accélère le déploiement des nouvelles technologies pour concrétiser deux mutations majeures : la transformation digitale et la transition énergétique. Ancrées dans les territoires et organisées en mode agile, les entreprises de VINCI Energies rendent les infrastructures d'énergie, de transport et de communication, les usines ainsi que les bâtiments chaque jour plus fiables, plus sûrs, plus efficients. 2021 : 15,1 milliards d'euros (chiffre d'affaires) \u002F\u002F 85 700 collaborateurs \u002F\u002F 1800 entreprises \u002F\u002F 55 pays opérationnelles standard (SOP) dans des processus clés et les déployer<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participer à des ateliers avec les équipes pour éliminer le gaspillage et optimiser le flux de processus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Aider à la mise en œuvre de la gestion des performances : travailler avec les équipes sur site pour implémenter les améliorations, les maintenir afin de respecter les délais et les limites du budget<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Niveau d'études : Bac +5<\u002Fp>\n <p> Spécialités : Logistique, Supply Chain<\u002Fp>\n <p> Expérience : 1 ou 2 ans en logistique en PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction Grands Projets emploie plus de 7000 collaborateurs et réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 md€ (données 2021). Héritier d'entreprises centenaires, qui ont associé leurs noms à des références majeures à l'échelle internationale, VINCI Construction Grands Projets maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire liés à la réalisation d'ouvrages complexes. VINCI Construction Grands Projets conçoit et réalise partout dans le monde de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment : infrastructures de transport (ponts et viaducs, travaux souterrains, linéaires de surface et maritimes), bâtiments (tours de bureaux et de logements, parkings, aéroports, ouvrages administratifs et culturels), énergies et oil &amp; gas (réservoirs GNL, centrales thermiques et nucléaires), infrastructures minières (accès, terrassements, travaux souterrains et à ciel ouvert, génie civil), infrastructures hydrauliques (barrages, stations de pompage et de traitement des eaux usées, distribution et évacuation des eaux) et environnement (systèmes d'assainissement et d'amélioration des réseaux d'eau potable, centres d'enfouissement technique). Le haut niveau d'expertise de VINCI Construction Grands Projets et sa forte capacité d'ingénierie et de management de projets vont de pair avec une organisation réactive et une politique de partenariat avec les entreprises locales, lui permettant de déployer des solutions à la fois globales et modulables.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> VINCI Construction LLC is a subsidiary of VINCI Construction Grands Projects located in Norfolk, Virginia, USA.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The scope of the company is general contracting and construction work, along with any associated services related to large selected Design and Build projects, either public or private for which it can bring clear and strong added value.<\u002Fp> \n <p> VINCI Construction LLC aim to develop engineering and construction services for large infrastructure projects in various parts in the United States and provide a highly skilled and competitive professional service in construction field.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Joint Venture including VINCI (33%), Dragados USA (42%), Flatiron Constructors (25%) has been awarded with a $3.3B design-build contract for the I-64 Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, which is the largest construction contract awarded in the history of the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Schedule Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining the project schedule and providing detailed time analysis to Project Managers\u002FEngineers.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Perform take-off of quantities and activities from construction drawings or other documents for creation of construction schedule.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create and maintain construction schedules based on specific requirement from multiple departments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Populate schedule with resource and cost information.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Update, maintain, and revise monthly and weekly schedules and reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Compare and report on comparisons of monthly schedules with regards to changes, delays or accelerations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare TIAs (Time Impact Analysis) for purpose of analyzing and implementing mitigation procedures to the project schedule.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identify warnings and risks to the project for the purpose of mitigating the impact of these risks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyze monthly schedules and prepare reports for the purpose of dispute resolution issue.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Preparation of baseline CPM Schedule.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support change order preparation in regards to time impacts and delays.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review project plans, requirements, and specifications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review and understand all bid documents related to schedule and project controls.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Compare and analyze competitive subcontractor and supplier bids.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree (Construction Management or Engineering preferred)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 8 years' experience in heavy civil or general engineering construction scheduling<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expert level knowledge of Primavera P6 and Excel<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Preferred:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to understand technical and complicated construction program and the ability to communicate progress to both technical- and management-level personnel<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expert level knowledge of Primavera P6 and Excel<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient - outstanding written and verbal skills including the ability to clearly and accurately communicate with any audience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to understand project logistics and project schedule<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with developing and producing various types of reports, targeting different audiences (i.e. critical path reports, resource histograms, past and project production needs, Time -Location, 4D BIM (Synchro or NAVISWORKS, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to reach and interpret construction drawings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent technical and mathematical abilities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in Microsoft <p>Vice President of Operations – Repairs East Coast<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> About Freyssinet:<br> <br> Freyssinet, Inc. has been at the forefront of civil engineering and specialized construction services since 1995. We form part of the Soletanche-Freyssinet Group, a name respected worldwide for delivering innovative solutions and pushing the envelope of civil and structural engineering. Originally a specialist in bridge components and post-tensioning, Freyssinet has successfully expanded its portfolio of products and services into repair, protection and strengthening of structures. We specialize in diagnostic surveys, repairs, rehabilitation and cathodic protection to reinforced concrete in the building, civil and marine sectors. With offices in Virginia, North Carolina and Florida, Freyssinet operates as general contractor, specialty subcontractor and supplier throughout the US. Freyssinet is able to support the full product and service range with an in-house engineering design team. Current company revenue $45M.<\u002Fp>\n <p> General Job Description:<br> As a member of the Management Team of Freyssinet, Inc., the Vice President of Operations – Repairs East Coast reports to the CEO and is responsible for the overall operations of Freyssinet activities in the Mid-Atlantic and South-Atlantic Regions of Freyssinet repair activities to include concrete repairs, strengthening, corrosion protection, coatings and waterproofing. Candidates should possess strong leadership and motivational skills, and the ability to manage projects and maintain financial budgets.<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <br> Responsibilities include:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Managing the delivery of projects totaling $30m+ annually.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Managing a team of Operations Managers, Project Managers, Projects Engineers, Superintendents and Field employees based in Sterling VA and Raleigh NC offices.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Managing all operations aspect of projects to ensure timely and on-budget delivery.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Working with Freyssinet support departments to ensure that company policies and processes are followed.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Working with clients to negotiate contractual issues, change orders, claims, back-charges and disputes within the limits of authority set by CEO.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assessing the need for personnel and working with Human Resources on recruiting.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Coordinating and optimizing field manpower and equipment to ensure that projects are complete within estimate and pre-construction budgets.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assisting in the maintenance, development, and enhancement of the company’s cost control systems to ensure on budget delivery of projects.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Mastering project scheduling to ensure on time delivery of projects.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Must be extremely safety conscious, setting an example for others by demonstrating that Safety is held in the highest regard. Wears safety equipment (hard hat with chin straps, eye protection, ear protection, respiratory protection, etc…) when required by the safety specifications or jobsite conditions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Engaging in Safety commitments provided by corporate office and ensuring that every project is incident-free.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><br> Education\u002FSkill\u002FExperience:<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> 1. Minimum of 10 years related experience<br> 2. Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or Construction Management<br> 3. Complete understanding of the construction concrete repair industry<br> 4. Computer knowledge and efficiency, including Microsoft Office products, construction scheduling software<br> 5. Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br> 6. Extensive knowledge of financial operations<br> 7. Proven risk management and contracting knowledge<br> 8. Excellent management skills<br> 9. Exhibits strong leadership qualities<br> 10. Ability to always maintain discretion and confidentiality<br> 11. Ability to delegate work appropriately<br> 12. Excellent time management and organizational skills<br> 13. Excellent judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions<br> 14. Excellent strategic thinking and visionary skills<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction est l'un des principaux acteurs mondiaux de la construction, dans le domaine des infrastructures de transport, des bâtiments, des réseaux et des aménagements urbains. VINCI Construction s'appuie sur un réseau de filiales de proximité, un réseau de spécialités et une expertise spécifique sur les grands projets d'infrastructures. Avec plus de 1300 entreprises, VINCI Construction intervient sur l'ensemble du cycle de vie d'un ouvrage (financement, conception, construction, rénovation, maintenance). Ce réseau de plus de 1300 entreprises, présentes dans plus de 100 pays, emploie près de 115 000 personnes et a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 26,2 milliards d'euros en 2021.<\u002Fp>\n pouvant relever des trois métiers de VINCI Concessions (aéroports, routes et ferroviaire) dans la phase d’appel d’offre et de closing de ces opérations. Vous accompagnerez le fort développement commercial de VINCI Concessions et de ses filiales dans le cadre d’appels d’offres pour de nouvelles opérations « greenfield » ou d’opérations « brownfield », dans le cadre de processus d’acquisitions auprès d’autres acteurs du secteur ou de privatisations.\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       Votre mission comporte également un volet d’appui à la     <b><br> Vos missions :<\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      <br> En lien avec les Financements Structurés, vos principales missions consisteront à :\n <\u002Ful>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <ul>\n      <li><br> Participer activement aux due diligences dans le cadre d'acquisitions de sociétés de projets, contribuer à l’identification et à l’analyse des risques, et à la structuration des opérations pour les maîtriser,<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <ul>\n      <li><br> Participer à la sélection des conseils financiers, et participer à la sélection des autres conseils sélectionnés pour l’opération, notamment quand leurs travaux impactent directement la levée du financement,<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <ul>\n      <li><br> Appuyer les senior project managers et directeurs de l’équipe dans la négociation des offres financières, de la documentation financière et dans la mise en œuvre des financements, jusqu’au closing financier,<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <ul>\n      <li><br> Mettre en œuvre la modélisation financière (avec l’appui, le plus souvent, de conseils financiers) et analyser les impacts financiers des projets pour le groupe, sous l'angle en particulier de la rentabilité des capitaux investis et des risques associés,<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <ul>\n      <li><br> Participer à une ou plusieurs équipes pluridisciplinaires constituées pour chaque projet de développement.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      <br> En lien avec la Direction Financière de Toll Plus, vous aurez pour missions :\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <ul>\n      <li><br> various duties such as the responsibility for assisting the accounting department in creating accurate and timely financial records for the organization\u002Fproject office.<br> <br> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. <p>Welcome to Sixense Satellite division:<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> SIXENSE, a subsidiary of Vinci Group, provides integrated support to designers, operators, and infrastructure owners to help them to successfully deal with their assets during construction and life cycle. With a strong worldwide coverage, today the SIXENSE team has more than 800 experts in 20 offices worldwide.<br> SIXENSE Satellite division is based in Barcelona and holds an international team of excellence with more than 20 years of experience processing Satellite images to measure deformation of buildings, infrastructure, and the ground surface. The Satellite team is involved in Industrial, Research and innovation projects worldwide.<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <br> About the role: \n  <br> \n  <br> The candidate will be part of the Satellite team, involved in the production of remote sensing services for current and future projects. The main tasks are:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Processing and analysis of satellite Synthetic Aperture Radar images with the Atlas processing chain to derive ground and asset deformation.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Development of algorithms and tools for new applications and methodologies, using artificial intelligence and\u002For other cutting-edge technologies. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Participation in R&amp;D studies mainly based on Remote Sensing and Data Science Solutions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Participate in internal technical meetings and assist marketing and sales departments for customer responses, as well as interact with different industrial or academic partners to present the results of your work in this context.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Requirements You bring:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Demonstrated knowledge in the field of Remote Sensing with a minimum of 3 years’ experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Experience in Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR)<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Knowledge and programming experience in: Python, Matlab, C++ and\u002For similar programming<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> language.\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Excellent written and oral reporting skills in English are mandatory.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Experience in GIS systems.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines, attain operational objectives assigned by<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> management.\n  <br> What makes you stand out\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>French or Spanish would be a valued skill.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Comprehension of civil engineering and geotechnics would be a valued skill.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Experience in Optical imagery processing would be a valued skill.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Organised and precise, willing, and capable of performing in a fast-changing environment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Curious and eager to expand your capabilities, willing to keep learning and acquiring new skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Focused on deadlines and results.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Passionate about the discipline, motivated and dynamic, a team player that would appreciate<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> joining a growing international companym\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Sixense, filiale de VINCI Construction, est un acteur de référence dans les domaines de la surveillance, l'ingénierie et la digitalisation au service des projets de construction et des infrastructures. Sixense s'appuie sur un réseau d'agences de proximité en France et de filiales internationales pour apporter son expertise en matière de conseil, technologies, services et gestion de données. Sixense prend ainsi le pouls des infrastructures, participe à la sécurisation de leur construction, de leur exploitation et l'optimisation de leur maintenance. Sixense est présent dans 20 pays, emploie près de 750 collaborateurs au sein de ses différentes divisions et a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 106 millions d'euros en 2021.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Contracts Administrator on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will support the Operations and Area Project Manager in the management and interfacing of Subcontracts.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Dragados, Flatiron, and VINCI has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Position Summary:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The primary role of the Contracts Administrator is to support the Operations and Area Project Manager in the management and interfacing of Subcontracts.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Engage with the project s engineering team, attend general design meetings, or specific task force meetings as needed to acquire the necessary level of understanding of technical issues with commercial implications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor the subcontract compliance with the terms and conditions of the Agreement. applicable; formally validate or refute with the Project Managers' prior approval<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare instructions for changes in applicable subcontract Scope of Services or Schedule.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyze the scope, schedule, and pricing of applicable Change Order Requests; negotiate, as applicable, with the coordination of the Contracts Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare and attend the <p>Vous recherchez une opportunité dans le financement de projet, à l’international, au sein d’une équipe formatrice ?<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vinci Concessions recherche son\u002Fsa prochain(e) Junior Project Finance Manager H\u002FFà Dallas en VIE.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Dans ce cadre, vous travaillerez avec la Direction des Financements Structurés de VINCI Concessions sur le montage et la structuration financière des projets de VINCI Concessions et de ses filiales : vous interviendrez ainsi sur des projets pouvant relever des trois métiers de VINCI Concessions (aéroports, routes et ferroviaire) dans la phase d’appel d’offre et de closing de ces opérations. Vous accompagnerez le fort développement commercial de VINCI Concessions et de ses filiales dans le cadre d’appels d’offres pour de nouvelles opérations « greenfield » ou d’opérations « brownfield », dans le cadre de processus d’acquisitions auprès d’autres acteurs du secteur ou de privatisations.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Votre mission comporte également un volet d’appui à la direction financière de notre filiale Toll Plus, filiale de VINCI Highways, actrice de premier plan de la collecte électronique de péages (ETC).<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vos missions :<\u002Fp>\n <p> En lien avec les Financements Structurés, vos principales missions consisteront à :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Participer à la mise en place du montage financier et contractuel des projets complexes, souvent à l'international,<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participer activement aux due diligences dans le cadre d'acquisitions de sociétés de projets, contribuer à l’identification et à l’analyse des risques, et à la structuration des opérations pour les maîtriser,<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participer à la sélection des conseils financiers, et participer à la sélection des autres conseils sélectionnés pour l’opération, notamment quand leurs travaux impactent directement la levée du financement,<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Appuyer les senior project managers et directeurs de l’équipe dans la négociation des offres financières, de la documentation financière et dans la mise en œuvre des financements, jusqu’au closing financier,<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Mettre en œuvre la modélisation financière (avec l’appui, le plus souvent, de conseils financiers) et analyser les impacts financiers des projets pour le groupe, sous l'angle en particulier de la rentabilité des capitaux investis et des risques associés,<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participer à une ou plusieurs équipes pluridisciplinaires constituées pour chaque projet de développement.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> En lien avec la Direction Financière de Toll Plus, vous aurez pour missions :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>L’assistance à l'implémentation du nouveau logiciel comptable NETSUITE en vue de la fusion de Toll Plus \u002F Cofiroute ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Le paramétrage, recettage, et l’élaboration de procédures financières conformément aux règles de compliance VINCI ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>En collaboration avec le responsable administratif en Financier de Toll Plus, la création et mise en place de tableaux de bord consolidés pour le management opérationnel ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>La participation active à la stratégie financière pre et post merger.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> De formation Universitaire, Ingénieur ou École de Commerce, vous justifiez d'une première expérience dans les financements de grands projets en entreprise ou dans un établissement financier (de type banque, fonds Infra ou Big 4).<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vous avez une réelle appétence pour la modélisation financière.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre curiosité, votre ouverture d’esprit et votre rigueur.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Au regard de la dimension internationale de cette opportunité une maîtrise de l’anglais est attendue.<\u002Fp>\n <p> La maîtrise d’une autre langue (espagnol et\u002Fou portugais en particulier) est un plus.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Concessions est un acteur international des concessions d'infrastructures de transport, engagé pour une croissance durable et partagée avec les territoires et les communautés. Nous concrétisons avec succès le potentiel du partenariat public-privé dans 21 pays, grâce à notre modèle intégré concessionnaire-constructeur et notre expertise en conception, financement, maîtrise d'ouvrage et exploitation-maintenance d'infrastructures de mobilité. Assurer une expérience positive à nos 2 millions clients par jour est l'objectif premier de nos 20 000 collaborateurs à travers le monde. VINCI Concessions réunit VINCI Airports - le premier opérateur privé mondial de la gestion aéroportuaire, VINCI Highways – un leader de la mobilité routière avec 3.564 km gérés dans 14 pays et VINCI Railways – pionner de la concession ferroviaire.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As an Accounts Payable Clerk on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the Project Controller with various duties such as being responsible to enter, track and maintain accounts payable records for all Project divisions and departments.<br> <br> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI, Flatiron, and Dragados USA has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project – the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Performs data entry for accounts payable vouchers, invoices, bills and expenses to ensure accurate and timely payment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitors department general email inbox account, vendor correspondences, and sorts and distributes mail<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Matches invoices, purchase orders and receivers prior to payment distribution. Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p> The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a General Superintendent on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the North &amp; South Trestle Manager with various duties such as to provide project management and oversight to assure construction projects are completed to company specifications. Assure that complete records are maintained, accurate, and up to date. Oversee the daily field operations of assigned project site.<br> <br> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Directly supervise employees.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage the coordination of all the site equipment, labor, and materials as well as program in time deliveries of material with Office Engineer<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Constant contact with the PM to ensure schedule, cost, and production is met and to anticipate management required with other third parties<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Confers with and directs supervisory personnel and subcontractors engaged in planning and executing work procedures, interpreting specifications, and coordinating various phases of construction to prevent delays.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Orders procurement of tools and materials to be delivered at specified times to conform to work schedules.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Confers with supervisory and engineering personnel and inspectors and suppliers of tools and materials to resolve construction problems and improve construction methods.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Inspects work in progress to ensure that workmanship conforms to specifications and the adherence to construction schedules<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares or reviews reports on progress, materials used and costs, and adjusts work schedules as indicated by reports<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Directs workers concerned with major maintenance or reconditioning projects for existing installations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Cost control, minimize unexpected costs and non-commodities in quality<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Attend coordination and production meetings with the PM to develop activities and amend possible problems related to structures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs other related duties as required and assigned<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>High school diploma or GED from an accredited institution<\u002Fli> \n involving roadway, structures, and\u002For bridges<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Strongly Encouraged:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general various duties such as to be responsible for exact measurements and determines property boundaries. They will be in charge of site survey works on a particular section in the HRBT Project for its construction aspect as defined in the contract, and accepts liability for its correct execution within the framework of the approved budget, the overall QHSE regulations, the ethic chart and the general and detailed planning.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Provide data relevant to the shape, contour, <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Field Engineer on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the Lead Field Engineer with various duties such as the construction activities of Section of the HRBT Project.<br> <br> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Conduct and coordinate his\u002Fher own works sections as well as the sub-contractor supervision<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review and selection of the works methods to proceed in coordination with the Sr. Supervisor\u002FSupervisor<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Preparation of detailed programs of the works he\u002Fshe is charge<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and liaise with Quality and Safety inspectors on a daily basis<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate to task brief at the beginning of each shift<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Regularly review and update Junior Staff &amp; Manpower requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Organize and Provide Daily documented record any S\u002FC deviation or issue<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Immediately inform his\u002Fher Line Manager of any significant accidents of near misses in line with the Project Safety Plan<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> <p>The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI, Flatiron, and Dragados USA has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project – the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As the Area Electrical Manager on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will review the Electricals plans submitted by contractors and you will lead an Electrical construction \u002F commissioning team to ensure compliance with the operational requirements of the project.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are in an exciting period of new opportunities in Finance in the USA. We are strengthening our pool of VIE and we are seeking a VIE - Financial Controller - Corporate finance F\u002FM who wants to be part of our Finance Department in the USA (Based in Orlando-Florida) and works on an international scope.<br> As part of the Finance team, you will play a key role in supporting the Head of Consolidation &amp; accounting for the Americas &amp; Oceania region thanks to diverse and varied missions.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Your key responsibilities will be:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Sub-group quarterly consolidations (about 40 entities): Process coordination (planning and instructions), assistance to local correspondents, cash-flows, balance sheet and certain P&amp;L accounts analysis<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Actively participating to the other sub-group reportings (off-balance sheet commitment, budgets for income taxes and cash-flows, Equity reconciliations…)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Implementing new cash-flows KPI at the countries level<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Establishing or drafting accounting policies; coordinating with corporate teams on consistent application of policies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performing other ad hoc projects to business managers with finance queries<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assisting the corporate teams during external growth, restructuring (technical accounting)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding the key IFRS rules for the area and ensuring their compliance throughout the countries (business acquisition, leasings, revenue recognition, (in)tangible assets…)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> A graduate of a Business school or University education (Bac+5) in accounting\u002FCorporate finance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> First experience of at least 12 months in Finance (including internship and\u002For apprenticeship),<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Basic accounting knowledge is required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are a methodical, curious, and analytical mind.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have excellent interpersonal skills, enjoy working in a team, and know how to adapt to new multicultural environments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Data analysis). Knowledge of SAP would be a plus.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A previous international experience would be an asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluency in English. You have good writing skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> To enter the VIE program, you have to be:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A European citizen aged between 18 and 28 on the date of registration, whatever training level;<br> A graduate student, with a fluent level in English;<br> Have never done any V.I.E. in the past;<br> Do not have worked previously in the host country.<\u002Fp>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <br> \n <ul>\n  <li> You will join a decentralized organization with decision-making close to the field;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will thrive and be part of an attractive mobility policy: Young Talent Community at VINCI Construction ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will gain a great working experience thanks to an inspirational working environment;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will develop technical and soft skills through mentoring<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction est l'un des principaux acteurs mondiaux de la construction, dans le domaine des infrastructures de transport, des bâtiments, des réseaux et des aménagements urbains. VINCI Construction s'appuie sur un réseau de filiales de proximité, un réseau de spécialités et une expertise spécifique sur les grands projets d'infrastructures. Avec plus de 1300 entreprises, VINCI Construction intervient sur l'ensemble du cycle de vie d'un ouvrage (financement, conception, construction, rénovation, maintenance). Ce réseau de plus de 1300 entreprises, présentes dans plus de 100 pays, emploie près de 115 000 personnes et a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 26,2 milliards d'euros en 2021. segment.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI, Flatiron, and Dragados USA has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project – the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Ensure coordination of the involvement of <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As the Mechanical Manager on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will review the Mechanical plans submitted by contractors and you will lead a mechanical construction \u002F commissioning team to ensure compliance with the operational requirements of the project.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p> The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Provides direction for Mechanical design activities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage daily activities deliverables and costs associated within the department<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilization of key performance indicators to follow-up of work progress<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Management and follow-up of Subcontractor work and construction\u002Fcommissioning work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interview and hire mechanical engineers as needed to build out the team<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage work assignments and workforce planning<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As the System Manager on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will review the ITS Systems plans submitted by contractors to ensure compliance with the operational requirements of the project.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p> The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Provides direction for ITS System design activities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage daily activities deliverables and costs associated within the department<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilization of key performance indicators to follow-up of work progress<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Management and follow-up of Subcontractor work and construction\u002Fcommissioning work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage work assignments and workforce planning<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor of Science degree in Construction Management or Engineering <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Entry-Level Drafter\u002F CAD Technician on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the CAD Manager with various duties such as to involve the issuance of methods drawings as per the set standards and QHSE Policies to be used in the HRBT Expansion Project.<br> <br> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Prepares means and methods drawings on the set in the CADD Manual<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that those drawings are compliant with the required standards by using designated softwares (AutoCAD, 2D, 3D and Autodesk Civil 3D)<\u002Fli> \n <li>Report about the progress of the design development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Circulate the drawings to the design or construction team for their further review and upon review, integrate the received comments through issuance of reviewed drawings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform other related duties as assigned<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> <p><b>The Company<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> VINCI Construction LLC is a subsidiary of VINCI Construction Grands Projets with its main office located in Alexandria, Virginia. The scope of the company is general contracting and construction work, along with any associated services related to large, selected Design and Build projects, either public or private for which it can bring clear and strong added value. We aim to develop engineering and construction services for large infrastructure projects in various parts in the United States and provide a highly skilled and competitive professional service in construction field.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> The Project<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project – the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p> The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>The Position<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As the HR Coordinator supporting the Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion (HRBT) Project on-site in Norfolk, Virginia, you will serve as a visible and instrumental part of the organization development and execution of key HR initiatives for the Company while supporting employees on the Project. This position will report to the HR Manager located at the Company's Alexandria, Virginia office.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Responsible for facilitation of day-to-day Human Resource functions including assisting in the recruitment process for all positions (such as open requisitions, job postings, schedule interviews, extend offers, and requisition close processes).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage new employee onboarding process to include company education, background screening compliance, and employee data input activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and conduct new hire orientations to lead the effective on-boarding process, including paperwork, applications, documentation, and maintaining employment files.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build and maintain relationships with management, subcontractors, and employees regarding support and closure, as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support company development plans and programs to ensure all staff are receiving proper training and experiences.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicate and implement company policies regarding employee issues, as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist with the Company Annual Appraisal process.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare outgoing mail and correspondence, including e-mails and marketing materials.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage the Company career fairs by attending networking events across the country.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate with the Project's Commercial Manager, on HR topics as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide administrative support and maintain HR reports for multiple departments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate Company employee morale functions, trainings, and events on-site.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs other related duties as required and assigned while exemplifying VINCI s values.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Administration<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum one year experience recruiting and facilitating the hiring\u002Fonboarding processes, with labor law compliance<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Key Skills and <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> VINCI Construction LLC (VC LLC) is a subsidiary of VINCI Construction Grands Projets (VCGP) with its main office located in Alexandria, Virginia. We are searching for a HR Project Coordinator that will provide daily human resources and project coordination support to international employees. This position will work on-site in Norfolk, Virginia.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The scope of the company is general contracting and construction work, along with any associated services related to large, selected Design and Build projects, either public or private for which it can bring clear and strong added value. We aim to develop engineering and construction services for large infrastructure projects in various parts in the United States and provide a highly skilled and competitive professional service in the construction field.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> The Project:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project – the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Purpose: <\u002Fb>Provide human resources and administration coordination to all expatriates (EXPATs) and trainees (VIEs) on the Project.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Serve as a liaison for all EXPATs and VIEs on the Project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible for Human Resource assistance, administration and coordination of all EXPATs and VIEs on the Project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide VCGP Finance &amp; Administration Officer with multiple reporting requirements, as needed (e.g. EXPAT &amp; VIE costs, budgeting, contract\u002F agreement renewal periods, and invoicing).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage EXPATs and VIE's new hire onboarding process to conduct new hire orientations for EXPATs and VIEs to include collection of Company and Project applications\u002F forms, documentation filing, and maintaining employment files confidentially.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide EXPATs and VIEs guidance on vehicles, hotel\u002F housing accomodations, utilities, creating USA banking accounts, USA identification documents (e.g. driver s license, SSN, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide EXPATs and VIEs with timely notices and status updates on visas (e.g. applications, renewals, expirations) and their dependents.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain updated rental insurance, schooling data and leasing agreements for EXPATs and VIEs on the Project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure EXPATS and VIEs are receiving professional development opportunities (e.g. training) by collaborating with VCGP and VC LLC HR Representatives.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist with the Annual Appraisal process of EXPATs and VIEs on the Project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare outgoing mail and correspondence, including e-mails, text messages and instant messaging.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build and maintain relationships with management, partners and employees<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide clerical and administrative support to multiple departments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide basic information technology support and assistance to EXPATs and VIEs on the Als Technician E\u002FI voer je reguliere werkzaamheden uit als preventief onderhoud, onderhoudstops en inspecties bij de klant. Daarnaast vind je het leuk om problemen op te lossen. Jij bent degene die wordt gebeld als er een storing is waar niemand meer uitkomt. Je bent een echte expert, een laatste redmiddel. Je onderzoekt waar een storing vandaan komt. Dit doe je zelfstandig of met een productiemedewerker. Is de installatie elektrisch veilig gesteld? Ligt de storing aan het PLC \u002F PC besturingssysteem? Staan de instellingen goed, of is er reparatie nodig? Allemaal vragen waar jij het antwoord op hebt. Je kijkt verder dan alleen de installatie. Storingen aan het netwerk tussen verschillende systemen weet jij op te sporen.\n <br> Vervolgens adviseer je over de benodigde actie, of voert deze zelf uit. Ten slotte zorg je voor de administratieve afwikkeling, om soortgelijke storingen in de toekomst te voorkomen.\n <br> \n <ul>\n  <li> MBO+ werk- en denkniveau richting elektrotechniek of besturingstechniek<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Minimaal 5 jaar tot 10 jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je beschikt over VCA basis diploma en NEN 3140<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je bent bereid om aanvullende cursussen te volgen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je bent bereid om in storingsdienst te werken, buiten reguliere kantoortijden<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Goede communicatieve vaardigheden<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je werkt nauwkeurig, bent flexibel, zelfstandig<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Doorgroeimogelijkheden! We zijn actief in 40 landen met ruim 21.000 collega’s en werken vanuit lokale business units. Actemium helpt opdrachtgevers in de industrie. Betere industriële prestaties zijn altijd het doel. Van advies en engineering tot realisatie, inbedrijfstelling en onderhoud. In Nederland doen we dit vanuit 19 business units met ongeveer 1000 collega’s. Daarbij kunnen we gebruik maken van de expertise van de andere merken van VINCI Energies.<br> <br> De business unit in Veendam en Zwolle helpt klanten bij vragen rondom engineering. Samen met zo’n 75 collega’s werken we voornamelijk aan mono- of multidisciplinaire projecten binnen de procesindustrie. Het werkgebied is Noord en Oost Nederland, maar kan breder zijn als dit nodig is voor een klant.<\u002Fp>\n company is general contracting and construction work, along with any associated services related to large selected Design and Build projects, either public or private for which it can bring clear and strong added value.<\u002Fp> \n <p> VINCI Construction LLC aim to develop engineering and construction services for large infrastructure projects in various parts in the United States and provide a highly skilled and competitive professional service in construction field.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Joint Venture including VINCI (33%), Dragados USA (42%), Flatiron Constructors (25%) has been awarded Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Manage and control all equipment and vehicle fleet at the goals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains the updated equipment inventory list.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Requests and collects information in regards to equipment utilization ratio and recommend a course of action to Management (needed\u002Fno longer needed at the project).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists the Manager in preparation of the project s equipment budget for the upcoming fiscal year.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains working knowledge of applicable codes and standards for a project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs technical administration of contracts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Enforces site safety at all <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Safety Coordinator (Inspector) on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the Deputy Safety Manager with various duties such as ensures that the construction site meets building codes and ordinances, zoning regulations, and contract specifications.<br> <br> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Reviews plans to ensure they meet construction site safety codes, local ordinances, zoning regulations, and contract specifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensures that the construction site s water and sewer systems, highways, streets, bridges, and dams conforms to detailed contract specifications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Inspects excavation and fill operations, the placement of forms for concrete or precast elements, concrete mixing and pouring, asphalt paving, and grading operations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews blueprints, writing reports, and schedules on-site inspections.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates and conducts safety training<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Approves construction plans that are satisfactory<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor construction sites periodically to ensure overall compliance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Uses survey instruments, metering devices, and test equipment to perform inspections<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Verifies alignment, level, and elevation of structures to ensure site meets specifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Issues violation notices and stop-work orders until construction site is compliant<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Keeps and tracks daily logs, including photographs taken during inspections<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provides written documentation of findings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Fosters companies policies and JV programs onsite, and enforces them with the employees (staff+labor)<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As an Estimator on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will prepare the estimates for assigned construction disciplines by analyzing specifications and contract plans to determine cost efficient quantities and construction practices to reach schedule and price goals.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Dragados USA, VINCI, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Reviews and incorporates historical data from purchase orders, subcontracts, productivity analysis reports, etc. into unit and person-hour figures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews final estimate to ensure defined work aligns with the overall project schedule and cost goals<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares discipline estimates by calculating takeoff of scope of work. Calculates material quantity requirements from engineering staff<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Consults with clients, vendors, or other individuals to discuss and formulate estimates and resolve issues<\u002Fli> <p>As a Subcontract Manager on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will negotiate and manage subcontract term and conditions for products and materials on the job.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados and Flatiron have been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Responsibilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Negotiates commercial terms and conditions with subcontractors and suppliers while consulting with operations, legal department and senior management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains professional relationships internally and externally.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Supports published project policies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs additional assignments per management s direction.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Actively participates in the close-out of agreements with subcontractors and vendors.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensures transfer of knowledge upon contract execution, and help the operations team understand the terms of the subcontract, and the role and obligations of each party.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Helps develop and promote good contracting practices in accordance with HRCP s subcontract management plan.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Engages and maintains constant communication with the field, and attend meetings as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Helps enforce the terms and conditions of the subcontracts and the Prime Contract. Helps in the resolution of commercial issues with subcontractors. Reviews draft correspondences from operations team. Supports the team in the review of subcontractor s requests for contract adjustments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitors flow of formal correspondences between HRCP and subcontractors and ensures that timely responses are provided.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identifies and reports commercial issues with subcontractors involving Owner within the required notification period.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains Project records.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><i>Required<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor s degree in Business, Supply Chain, Construction Management or a related field required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5+ years experience in negotiation, contract management or construction purchasing required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to negotiate contracts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Power Point, Word, Excel) and database utilization. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to identify, track and communicate project plan steps and actions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Team player with the ability to work independently to meet fixed deadlines, goals and objectives.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><i>Preferred<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>JD Edwards E1 World experience is a plus.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in heavy civil engineering design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Heavy civil construction knowledge.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to perform multiple tasks efficiently and accurately.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Detail-oriented.<\u002Fli>\n <div>\n  Voor het team Consultancy zijn wij op zoek naar een nieuwe collega! Samen met 8 andere collega’s ondersteun jij collega’s en klanten door ze te adviseren en risico gebaseerde oplossingen te creëren. Als Cybersecurity Consultant breng je de risico’s van de OT-omgeving van onze klanten in kaart en bepaal je de benodigde beveiligingsmaatregelen gebaseerd op de risico’s. Je gaat aan de slag met mooie projecten in verschillende branches. Afhankelijk van jouw achtergrond en wensen zullen wij jou zoveel als mogelijk inzetten op de klussen waar jij je thuis voelt, binnen de verschillende onderwerpen. Met jouw expertise en passie voor het vak draag jij zorg voor het oppakken van projecten. Je bent een zelfstandig werkende professional. Je krijgt energie van meerdere projecten uitvoeren en gaat hier vol passie mee aan de slag. Met jouw communicatieve vaardigheden ondersteun én adviseer jij je klanten. Jij weet wat er bij de klant speelt en begrijpt welke invloed dat heeft op hun bedrijfsprocessen. Tevens vind je het ook prettig om in teamverband interne klussen op te pakken en sta je regelmatig stil bij je eigen ontwikkeling op technisch en persoonlijk vlak. \n  <br> \n  <br> Wat ga je doen?\n  <ul>\n   <li> Technische richting geven en optreden als deskundige met betrekking tot cyberbeveiliging in industriële besturingssystemen;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Onze klanten helpen bij het bepalen van hun strategie voor hun OT-cyberbeveiligingsprogramma;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> OT-Security Risk Assessments uitvoeren om beveiligingsrisico's te identificeren;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Bedreigingen en kwetsbaarheden vertalen naar bedrijfsrisico’s en daaropvolgend beleid en procedures ontwikkelen om deze risico's aan te pakken;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Opstellen van specificaties voor beveiligingsvereisten op basis van geïdentificeerde kwetsbaarheden en risico’s;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Cyberbeveiligingstechnologieën technisch evalueren en haalbaarheidsbeoordelingen geven;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Evalueren van huidige en nieuwe, op beveiliging gerichte, tools en diensten;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assisteren van onze Cliëntmanagers met pre-sales ondersteuning.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Wij zoeken een consultant, met Cybersecurity ervaring in het OT domein, die enthousiast wordt van deze rol en zich hierin helemaal wil vastbijten! Je bent analytisch en communicatief sterk. Uiteraard hopen we ook dat je vinkjes kunt zetten bij onderstaande wensen vanuit onze kant:<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Een afgeronde Technische BSc\u002FMSc\u002FPhD-graad;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Kennis van relevante beveiligingsstandaarden, frameworks en richtlijnen zoals IEC-62443, NIST SP800-53, NIST SP800-82, NIST CSF en CIS;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Brede kennis van en ervaring met OT-systemen op de verschillende Purdue-modelniveaus: MES\u002FMOMS, SCADA\u002FHMI, PLC\u002FDCS, industriële netwerken en communicatieprotocollen;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Technische kennis op het gebied van systeem- en netwerkbeveiliging, authenticatie- en beveiligingsprotocollen, cryptografie en applicatiebeveiliging;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Het vermogen om risicomodellering te articuleren en technische concepten in eenvoudige bewoordingen te communiceren, zowel mondeling als in schriftelijke rapporten;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ervaring met het toepassen van dreigingsmodellering of andere technieken voor risico-identificatie;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Goede (technische) schrijf- en presentatievaardigheden (Nederlands, Engels).<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Naast een gezellig team van professionals en veel vrijheid bieden wij jou het volgende:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Een baan met veel afwisselende werkzaamheden en ruimte om je werk uit te voeren<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Een laptop en telefoon<\u002Fli>\n  <li> 25 vakantiedagen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Een vaste onkostenvergoeding per maand<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Winstuitkering<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leaseauto<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexibele werkomstandigheden en goede arbeidsvoorwaarden<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Een team met gezellige collega’s en informele werksfeer<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mooie en uitdagende projecten binnen de industriële automatisering<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Doorgroeimogelijkheden! We investeren in jouw kennis en loopbaan<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Toegang tot 100+ onlinetrainingen via GoodHabitz en Pluralsight<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Voordelig aandelen verwerven via het CASTOR-spaarprogramma<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Actemium is een merk van VINCI Energies. We zijn actief in 41 landen met ruim 22.000 collega’s en werken vanuit lokale business units. Actemium helpt opdrachtgevers in de industrie. Betere industriële prestaties zijn altijd het doel. Van advies en engineering tot realisatie, inbedrijfstelling en onderhoud. In Nederland doen we dit vanuit 22 business units met ongeveer 1000 collega’s. Daarbij kunnen we gebruik maken van de expertise van de andere merken van VINCI Energies.<br> <br> Vanuit consultancy richten wij ons op de vraagstukken van klanten en (nieuwe) onderwerpen uit de markt. Dit doen we om zo snel mogelijk met klanten samen de mogelijke vraagstukken te kunnen identificeren en vertalen naar oplossingen die we als Actemium kunnen leveren. Hierbij zijn wij niet specifiek actief binnen één segment maar bedienen wij alle soorten klanten. Binnen de Advice, Design, Build, Maintain en Improve cirkel zijn wij dus gericht op het advies deel. Hierin helpen wij om bewustzijn te creëren en haalbaarheid van functioneel en technische vraagstukken te beantwoorden. Dit hebben wij dan weer onderverdeeld in verschillende onderwerpen te weten;<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Cybersecurity vraagstukken<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Data Analytics vraagstukken<\u002Fli>\n   <li> MES <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Senior CAD Technician \u002F Drafter on the Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project, you will be responsible for preparing plans to be used in engineering and construction, including highway, bridge, and tunnel components. You will support our engineering department in designing and drafting plans, roadway profiles, cross-sections, and general civil engineering\u002Finfrastructure project elements. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Prepares means and methods drawings on the construction methods, sequence of works, temporary works, formwork definition as well as lifting operations and logistic issues, including scaffolding and accesses<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that all the Requirements from Employers and any parties are met and that no objections can be provided to the permanent construction<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that the drawings are developed using the workflows set in the CADD Manual<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that those drawings are compliant with the required standards by using designated softwares (AutoCAD, 2D, 3D, and Autodesk Civil 3D)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with other departments and engineers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Integrate quality and safety measurements and prevent any risks in the execution methods and sequence drawings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Report about the progress of the design development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Circulate the drawings to the design or construction team for their further review and upon review, integrate the received comments through the issuance of reviewed drawings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Train and mentor junior drafters<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist the engineering department in creating standards, libraries, and templates<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform other related duties as assigned<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>High school diploma or GED from an accredited institution.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum of 5 years experience as Draftsman\u002FCAD Designer in the construction industry and in infrastructure works (roadway, bridge, tunnel, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 2 years experience using AutoCAD Civil 3D software.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 1-year experience in Formwork, Work Sequences, and Construction Methods drawings<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Strongly Encouraged:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Associate or bachelor s degree in an applicable field<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in infrastructure 3D Modeling such as building pads, alignment, and profile design, roadway modeling, DTM modeling, drainage, cross-sections, and quantity take-offs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with MicroStation GEOPAK SS4 or Bentley Openroads designer<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge or experience in BIM software, such as Revit, Navisworks or Synchro<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Key Skills and Knowledge:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Highly developed communication, both written and
