<p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> VINCI Construction LLC is a subsidiary of VINCI Construction Grands Projects located in Norfolk, Virginia, USA.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The scope of the company is general contracting and construction work, along with any associated services related to large selected Design and Build projects, either public or private for which it can bring clear and strong added value.<\u002Fp> \n <p> VINCI Construction LLC aim to develop engineering and construction services for large infrastructure projects in various parts in the United States and provide a highly skilled and competitive professional service in construction field.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Joint Venture including VINCI (33%), Dragados USA (42%), Flatiron Constructors (25%) has been awarded with a $3.8B design-build contract for the I-64 Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, which is the largest construction contract awarded in the history of the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principal\u002FEssential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Deputy QC Manager will be responsible for tracking planned VS actual in terms of schedule activities, resource allocated and cost invoiced. Main duties and responsibilities as Quality Manager for the I-64 HRBT project will be as follows:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Track 4 week lookahead (4WLA) and plan of day activities against allocated QA\u002FQC resource.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate with the Area QC Managers weekly on QC resource allocation to each project area to establish opportunities for optimization<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track the QC materials stock against material use and report monthly to QC Manager (QCM).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review correspondence from QA\u002FQC subconsultants and provide draft feedback to QCM.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop a strong similarity with the contract agreements and Change Orders for all QA\u002FQC subconsultants to support disputes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review the HRBT Contract Specifications and all other relevant documentation to understand the acceptance criteria for each trade and discipline.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish a system for periodic review of the project Sharepoint – Quality platform for timely submission for deliverable of QA\u002FQC subconsultants.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Verify the Testing Laboratories invoices and advise the QCM of any discrepancies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Verify the QA\u002FQC monthly invoices and advise the QCM of any discrepancies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review and approve Material Approval Forms, Quality Record Package and As-built Documentation.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review and approve weekly and monthly KPI and Quality Reports and Quality Record Packages.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop &amp; Monitor Monthly KPIs for planned VS actual staff and cost.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead the process that support negotiations of claims, manage contractual changes and resolve disputes or conflict resolution with subconsultants.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Verify redline plans - sheets for accuracy against the AFC drawings\u002Fspecs related to RFIs, FCRs, FDCs, NCRs and any other document that may create a need for a mark-up.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Oversee redline plan set progress against the working schedule for timely completion<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate with responsible Field Engineers (FE) on redline error and oversights within the assigned.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering, <p>Le projet Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT), Virginie, USA recherche un contrat VIEen logistique en tant que chargé(e) d'amélioration continue de la performance.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vous serez rattaché(e) au responsable Project Performance Improvement Officerdu projet.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vos missions:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Participer au développement de la philosophie et pratiques temps et de déplacement pour identifier les gaspillages et les opportunités d'amélioration potentielles<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Recueillir et analyser des données pour aider à la prise de décision<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Centraliser les données transverses pour réaliser un tableau de bord du projet et aider à automatiser le traitement des données<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Développer des procédures opérationnelles standard (SOP) dans des processus clés et les déployer<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participer à des ateliers avec les équipes pour éliminer le gaspillage et optimiser le flux de processus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Aider à la mise en œuvre de la gestion des performances : travailler avec les équipes sur site pour implémenter les améliorations, les maintenir afin de respecter les délais et les limites du budget<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Niveau d'études : Bac +5<\u002Fp>\n <p> Spécialités : Logistique, Supply Chain ou Génie Civil<\u002Fp>\n <p> Expérience : 1 ou 2 ans en MERCI DE POSTULER AVEC UN CV EN ANGLAIS POUR FACILITER LE PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction Grands Projets emploie plus de 7000 collaborateurs et réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 md€ (données 2021). Héritier d'entreprises centenaires, qui ont associé leurs noms à des références majeures à l'échelle internationale, VINCI Construction Grands Projets maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire liés à la réalisation d'ouvrages complexes. VINCI Construction Grands Projets conçoit et réalise partout dans le monde de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment : infrastructures de transport (ponts et viaducs, travaux souterrains, linéaires de surface et maritimes), bâtiments (tours de bureaux et de logements, parkings, aéroports, ouvrages administratifs et culturels), énergies et oil &amp; gas (réservoirs GNL, centrales thermiques et nucléaires), infrastructures minières (accès, terrassements, travaux souterrains et à ciel ouvert, génie civil), infrastructures hydrauliques (barrages, stations de pompage et de traitement des eaux usées, distribution et évacuation des eaux) et environnement (systèmes d'assainissement et d'amélioration des réseaux d'eau potable, centres d'enfouissement technique). Le haut niveau d'expertise de VINCI Construction Grands Projets et sa forte capacité d'ingénierie et de management de projets vont de pair avec une organisation réactive et une politique de partenariat avec les entreprises locales, lui permettant de déployer des solutions à la fois globales et modulables.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As Fleet &amp; Logistics Manager on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will focus on the data assimilation, tracking, and coordination of project-wide fleet &amp; equipment logistics under the direction of the Equipment Manager.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Dragados, Flatiron, and VINCI has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Supervise all aspects related to the project vehicle fleet<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Administer vehicle fuel\u002Fmaintenance card program(s)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Research and evaluate new potential agreements related to fleet &amp; equipment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review and analyze all aspects and information obtained from current agreements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist with the negotiation of project rental, lease, and purchase agreements, in order to obtain the best discounts, processes, and services<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lives and breathes the Safety First mantra<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensures compliance with federal, state, and company vehicle licensing &amp; titling<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Attend meetings and networks and are required to gather project information or data on new tools, equipment, vehicles or services<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Serve as a liaison for the <p>Geloof jij dat een duurzaam beleid in Learning &amp; Development een meerwaarde is voor een bedrijf? Wil jij graag de lead nemen in de ontwikkeling en implementatie van dergelijk beleid in een dynamische organisatie? Dan is deze uitdagende functie zeker iets voor jou!<\u002Fp>\n <p> Functieomschrijving<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Je tekent in nauwe samenwerking met het management het beleid uit rond Learning &amp; Development.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je stelt op basis van de behoeften van de organisatie jaarlijks een opleidingsplan op.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je zoekt naar geschikte opleidingen rekening houdend met de beschikbare budgetten.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het opstellen en uitwerken van e-learning projecten van nieuwe en bestaande opleidingen.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je zorgt samen met je team voor de administratieve afhandeling en opvolging van de geplande opleidingen.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je coördineert de afdeling Learning &amp; Development en coacht, adviseert en ondersteunt de medewerkers van het team om een optimale dienstverlening te garanderen.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je neemt deel aan werkgroepen en blijft op de hoogte van de nieuwe trends en instrumenten op het gebied van personeelsontwikkeling.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Je bezit een master diploma in een HR gerelateerde richting.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Je hebt ten minste 3 tot 5 jaar relevante werkervaring in het L&amp;D vakgebied.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Je bezit over een visie, uitstekende organisatorische vaardigheden en je bent communicatief sterk.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Je bent analytisch ingesteld en resultaatgericht.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Je kan jezelf vlot uitdrukken in het Nederlands en Frans, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Je hebt een goede kennis van MS Office.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Je bent bereid om je te verplaatsen naar onze verschillende vestigingen.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Je bent in het bezit van rijbewijs B.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Bij Actemium - merk van VINCI Energies - aan de slag gaan, betekent kiezen voor een innovatieve omgeving, met gepassioneerde collega’s.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> We geven je zowel de omkadering (training en coaching) als de opportuniteiten nodig om je loopbaan een échte impuls te geven.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je komt terecht in een bedrijf waar veiligheid en collegialiteit voorop staan.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> We werken een persoonlijk ontwikkelingsplan voor je uit dat afgestemd is op jouw ambities en sterktes. Dankzij onze organisatiestructuur en duidelijke loopbaanpaden heb je zicht op je toekomst en blijf je groeien.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je kan rekenen op een contract van onbepaalde duur, met een compleet en competitief verloningspakket. Wij bieden daarnaast een interessante verlofregeling, tal van opleidingsmogelijkheden en andere extralegale voordelen.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> We organiseren ook diverse sportieve, culturele en familiale activiteiten.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Kom aan boord en ontdek the ‘VINCI Energies way of life’!<\u002Fp>\n <p> VINCI Energies wil een inclusieve werkgever zijn, een plek waar iedereen zich goed voelt, waar iedereen gelijke kansen krijgt, ongeacht geslacht, gender of cultuur.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Alle zij’s, die’s en hij’s hebben het recht om te zijn wie ze zijn en moeten de kans krijgen om zich ten volle te ontplooien. <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Yard Superintendent on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will schedule, coordinate and supervise production and workforce engaged in your assigned area of the project. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI, Flatiron, and Dragados USA has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project – the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p> The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Supervises assigned project work and liaises between field engineering, estimating, and field staff to ensure project compliance with contract specifications and material and equipment needs in the field<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plans work methods, materials, equipment needs, and work schedule for assigned project work. Reviews daily work schedule with direct reports and provide input for weekly\u002Fmonthly schedule updates based on project<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews and understands the project specifications to support job setup activities. Works with work crews, field engineers, and other project stakeholders to identify hazardous areas on job<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Attends and participates in daily meetings to coordinate project marine logistical needs for assigned area of the project<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manages multiple crews specializing in marine logistical services and material handling<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates with internal equipment team and external vendors to ensure that project is equipped with appropriate equipment and material quantities to complete production within assigned budget and<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates with subcontractors delivery of materials manage unloading, staging, storage, and trans-loading of materials inland to the marine environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Procure\u002Fmaintain stock of project consumables and coordinate the logistics of delivery and return of these materials to the project fleet<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Forecasts the work schedule to identify possible issues and provides technical or scheduling recommendations to mitigate production<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provides technical input to identify and resolve project risks including construction methods, work plan, and material requirements, safety, and schedule activities. Documents daily activities and meeting notes using Company approved document<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates with internal and external departments to ensure all mandated inspections are completed within the requested timeframes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Supports and promotes strict adherence to safety and process controls regarding operating equipment, worksite safety, and documentation requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Supervises sub-contractor production and workforce regarding assigned project work. Recommends work schedule or work method adjustments regarding sub-contractor activities, as<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates project close-out activities in line with project standards and Owner checklist requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs additional assignments per management <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years of heavy marine construction experience, specializing in material handling, with at least 3 years of management experience required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong knowledge and familiarity with the operation and maintenance of crawler cranes, marine cranes, barges, securing materials on barges, forklifts, loaders, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advanced knowledge of construction site safety protocols and proven ability to enforce project safety programs<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Strongly Encouraged:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree considered a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Safety Trained Supervisor (STS) certification preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid Driver s License<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Key Skills and Knowledge:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Strong written, verbal, and presentation communication skills required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong leadership capability with an internal drive to mentor and grow internal talent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to read, analyze, and interpret standards and contract-specific plans and specifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistics, and fundamentals geometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Strongly Encouraged:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Be able to work in a workstation subject to office noise<\u002Fli>\n <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Workshop Superintendent on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will act as the main point of contact between field maintenance, yard equipment, and the project equipment department.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Main point of contact between the field personnel for maintenance and yard equipment department personnel and the equipment department management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Direct the filling and assignment of work orders, receiving of material from vendors and restock, loading and scheduling of delivery route trucks, maintenance and upkeep of the Willoughby yard.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in the preparation, implementation, and tracking of the equipment maintenance plans.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as assigned.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> piling hammers, engines, electrical, and hydraulic systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years experience managing maintenance staff (mechanics, electricians, and welders).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advanced knowledge of construction site equipment operation and maintenance requirements.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Strongly Encouraged:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Previous experience in the US is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advanced knowledge of construction site equipment operation and maintenance requirements.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Key Skills and <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As an ITS Manager on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the Utilities Manager and work closely with the VDOT operations to ensure the existing systems are undisrupted during construction and implementation of the new ITS infrastructure. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI, Flatiron, and Dragados USA has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project – the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9-mile section of I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Ensure existing ITS systems are maintained during construction and installation of the temporary and permanent systems <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensure installation, testing, and switchover of the temporary and permanent systems does not impact operations of the existing systems <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Review installation plans for compatibility with the existing infrastructure and confirm installation can be achieved as planned <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Liaise with the VDOT Representative and provide notifications of work planned, work locations, and systems outages in accordance with the Contract provisions <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinate work with private utilities and subcontractors to achieve completion of work areas in accordance with the master schedule <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Examine and interpret construction plans, schedules, and quantities to ensure quality construction processes and procedures that include but are not limited to fiber trunk line, CCTV, Over Height Detectors, Traffic Counters, DMS installation, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate construction inspection staff in functional areas such as construction inspection, surveying, and material sampling, and testing <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Act as the HRCP representative for communication with subcontractors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate subcontractor work with owner representatives <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Report progress of work, construction issues, etc. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Verify that work is performed safely and in accordance with the project plans and specifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate subcontractor field verification of existing owner ITS infrastructure<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review subcontractor installation plans for completeness and conformance with the Technical Requirements <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Review subcontractor outage plans for completeness and coordination with the owner s requirements <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Travel from Project office to various on-\u002F off-site locations<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and or Electrical) or 12 years of systems testing and integration experience <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Working knowledge of the principles and practices of civil engineering and construction methods, materials, and equipment <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience in reading and interpreting ITS construction plans <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience in contract administration ensuring projects are constructed in accordance <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Senior Project Scheduler on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the Project Schedule Manager with various duties such as reporting and project coordination. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Dragados, Flatiron, and VINCI has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Develops and manages conceptual (RFP), bidding (preconstruction) and final project schedules from preliminary and ongoing project information for estimating, preconstruction, and operations departments use <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develops, maintains, and presents the complete master schedule including Engineering, Procurement, and Construction activities; provides timely updates and integration with the area, vendor, and subcontractor schedules identifying deviations and schedule slippages <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Attends job site meetings, work and meet with stakeholders, and contact and visit job sites in order to develop the project schedule <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develops standard and custom graphs and charts for site personnel to manage the project<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares Time Impact Analysis for identified risks to schedule and budget<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provides support and guidance to ensure the baseline schedule submission is timely, complete, accurate, and in compliance with standard company procedures and the contract<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists jobs as needed with schedule maintenance and change order management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participates in financial and legal project reviews as necessary to evaluate and mitigate any schedule risk in accordance with standard company procedures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Builds owner activities, project close-out activities, and activities from Technical Services and Safety Departments into all project schedules<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develops documentation for claims - assist operations personnel in identifying situations where a claim is likely and take early steps to prevent these claims and\u002For defend the company and, as appropriate the owner, from these claims<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participates in meetings regarding project delay issues and suggest alternative means and methods of scheduling in order to recover the project s progress as appropriate<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares monthly schedule status report for project management and the Scheduling Manager<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains knowledge of Company values and strategic plan<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform additional assignments per management s direction<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor s Degree from an accredited institution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum seven (7) years of heavy construction scheduler experience<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Strongly Encouraged:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor s Degree in Construction Science, Construction Management, Construction Engineering, or Civil Engineering preferred<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Key Skills and Knowledge:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Ability to interface and effectively communicate with others<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advanced knowledge of Primavera P6<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven skill and ability to identify and mitigate scheduling issues for simple and complex construction projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient with the generation and maintenance of cost and resource-loaded schedules<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to self-prioritize and self-start projects and task work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively multi-task similar activities in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong problem-solving and analytical skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advanced verbal, written, and presentation communication skills<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Project Engineer on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the Lead Project Engineer with various duties such as tasks related to the collection of project data required to monitor project performance, budget, schedule and quality, ensuring all construction work complies with engineering standards, codes and contract specifications.<br> <br> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Provides technical input for project work plan and scheduling. Identifying risk elements of production, materials, equipment or process that could negatively impact the budget or schedule<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists in the production and review of shop drawings, design specifications, material requirements and project data to ensure quality and contract specification compliance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists the development of design drawings and provides technical input, as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Meets with engineering team to review production schedule and confirm all materials, equipment and resources are readily available for production to continue on schedule and within budget<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluates weekly and monthly production, schedule and budget projections to accurately track project performance. Documents daily activities in project approved methods and technologies<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews project schedule updates weekly for owner and management reporting. Attends weekly regular meetings where required and presents on project production status as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares and manages a three-week work plan. Notifies engineering and project management of any significant schedule changes and develops solutions to mitigate delays and cost<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Initiates and manages Requests for Information (RFIs), as needed by project<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Remits accurate project quantities using assigned project cost coding to ensure project financials are accurately reported. In collaboration with the project accounting team oversees invoices regarding materials, equipment and subcontractor needs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Supports engineering team with quality assurance as needed. Reviews certificates and permits needed to perform work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews required Job Hazard Analysis (JHAs) to ensure a safe and compliance work environment for all construction personnel. Participates in all weekly safety meetings with field team and project leadership; presents field analysis as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists the project team with project schedule, budget and cost parameters by providing technical input as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates subcontractor work methods, schedule and crews as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform additional assignments per management <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Procurement Coordinator on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the Procurement Manager with various duties such as become a specialist for all Construction Material and Sub Contract procurement in conjunction with the rest of the department.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Dragados, VINCI, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT).<\u002Fp> \n <p> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Management of the project procurement plan in accordance with approved corporate and or project policies, procedures, plans, strategy and budgets<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicate with bidders and suppliers or subcontractors on all procurement related matters<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Oversee the preparation of the bid inquiry documents, bid tabulations and selection recommendations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead contract negotiations and preparation, including issuing approval of contract documents, subcontracts and purchase orders<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Oversee Coordination of expediting, logistics and traffic with respect to the delivery of supplier equipment and materials delivered to site<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Research new materials for design and cost savings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop and implement new purchasing strategies to deliver ongoing cost reductions and process simplification<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain existing relationships with subcontractors and suppliers, and establish new relationships to ensure adequate resources for all projects and to continually improve pricing and quality of work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in settling invoice or contract disputes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interface with project segment managers and contract administrators, buyers, expeditors, inspectors, materials controllers, transportation and logistics and other parties as required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs other related duties as required and assigned<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform additional assignments per management s direction<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 3 years field or project-based procurement experience in the construction industry<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Strongly <p>As a Cost Estimator on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will prepare the estimates for assigned construction disciplines by analyzing specifications and contract plans to determine cost efficient quantities and construction practices to reach schedule and price goals.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Dragados USA, VINCI, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Responsibilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Reviews and incorporates historical data from purchase orders, subcontracts, productivity analysis reports, etc. into unit and person-hour figures.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews final estimate to ensure defined work aligns with overall project schedule and cost goals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares discipline estimates by calculating takeoff of scope of work. Calculates material quantity requirements from engineering staff.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Consults with clients, vendors, or other individuals to discuss and formulate estimates and resolve issues.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists with cost evaluations related to change orders based on cost, engineering quality, or availability of materials.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains knowledge of Company s values and strategic plan.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support published corporate policies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform additional assignments per management s direction.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>This position may require visit to the job site to perform crew composition analysis\u002Ftime-studies. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><i>Required<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or Construction Management from an accredited institution highly preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years experience in a heavy civil estimating or cost control.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years experience in heavy civil infrastructure industry (roads, bridges, tunnels, etc.) focused on estimating or cost control.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to be read design drawings and identify scopes of work, perform quantity take-off and prepare estimate.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient with Excel, HCSS, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and pdf-based quantity take-off softwares.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong organization skills with attention to detail. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><i>Preferred<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Ability to work in fast-paced environment and meet all project deadlines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be a team player and have flexibility\u002Fdesire to take on numerous tasks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communication and interpersonal skills for clear and effective support research, recommendations, and pricing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Technical writing skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Time management and strong prioritization skills to meet tight turnaround and bid deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n<\u002Fdiv>","contentKind":"HTML"},"screenerRequirementsModel":null,"showExpiredHeader":false,"tagModels":null,"viewJobDisplay":"DESKTOP_EMBEDDED"},"sectionedJobInfoModel":null},"jobKey":"0a9ae1d6a9612385","jobLocation":"Norfolk, <p>As an Equipment (DOT) Compliance Manager on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will be responsible for all Department of Transportation files along with conveyance and tracking of all DOT vehicles and similar functions. Additionally, managing all inventory of materials and yards for operations throughout the project s staff. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Dragados, VINCI, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Supplementary activities will include assisting the Fleet\u002FLogistics Manager with daily activities and all other tasks Onze passie ligt voornamelijk in de technische installaties van gebouwen. Dit wil zeggen dat onze contracten in gebouwen als ziekenhuizen, kantoorgebouwen, industrieën, scholen, gevangenissen, enzovoort zijn.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Hier streven wij naar een vijfsterren klanten service in de HVAC Sector.<\u002Fp>\n <p> TAKEN:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Algemene elektriciteitswerken<\u002Fli>\n  <li> laatsen en aansluiten van verdeelborden en industriële componenten, Diverse reparaties uitvoeren om de goede werking van de installatie te verzekeren.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Gedetailleerde rapporten opmaken, de klanten informeren van de vooruitgangen, de hiërarchische lijn Desk.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Oog hebben voor commerciële opportuniteiten bij de klanten en deze doorgeven aan de leidinggevende zodat de objectieven van de organisatie kunnen bereikt worden.<\u002Fli>\n <p>Sixense, a subsidiary of Vinci Group, provides integrated support to designers, operators, and infrastructure owners to help them to successfully deal with their assets during construction and life cycle. With a strong worldwide coverage, today the Sixense team has more than 800 experts in &gt;20 offices worldwide.<br> Sixense Satellite division is based in Barcelona and holds an international team of excellence with more than 20 years of experience processing Satellite images to measure deformation of buildings, infrastructure, and ground surface. The Satellite team is involved in Industrial, Research and innovation projects worldwide.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The role is within the commercial department but very close to the technical department and implies to develop and maintain favourable relationships with clients, understanding their needs and support the preparation of technical proposals.<br> This person will have to work collaboratively with existing commercial network and partners to maximise company commercial position and new opportunities. Helps create and executes business plans on each of Sixense territories. This person will have a high impact role as support to international business developers working in close relationship with the Managing Director and Technical &amp; Operation manager.<\u002Fp>\n construction et des infrastructures. Sixense s'appuie sur un réseau d'agences de proximité en France et de filiales internationales pour apporter son expertise en matière de conseil, technologies, services et gestion de données. Sixense prend ainsi le pouls des infrastructures, participe à la sécurisation de leur construction, de leur exploitation et l'optimisation de leur maintenance. <p>As a Project Manager on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the Area 2 Project Manager with various duties such as to be responsible for the overall project management, supervision, coordination, and successful completion of the project in accordance with client requirements, organizational policies\u002Fprocedures, contract specifications, and time and cost specifications. This role will demonstrate a complete understanding of the business operation. This role focused on expanding two manmade islands in an open water environment. <br> <br> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Oversees and reviews the design to build construction phase to refine plans and control costs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensures that project staff is following Joint Venture policies and procedures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews and approves construction work plans for definable features of work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develops and tracks procurement plan for the responsible scope of work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Schedule and coordinate construction site processes so that projects meet design specifications and technical requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that area site is completed on time and within budget by preparing cost estimates, work schedule and deadlines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish, maintain and review project plans, requirements, specifications and permits applications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Forecast revenue and profitability<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manages construction project personnel and subcontractor s schedule and duties<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interprets and explains contracts and technical information to staff<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Fosters business relationships with Joint Venture Partners, Owners, Business Manager, Engineers and subcontractors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provides written reports to designated project partners, teams and supervisor<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Report work progress and budget matters to clients<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate and coordinate with the other construction managers and staff such as engineers, and other specialists<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Respond to work delays, emergencies, and other problems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Consult and partner with inspectors to ensure that all regulations are met<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform cost estimator duties and knowledge of planning software that tracks progress to complete their projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage all quality control and change control processes. Coordinate Quality Assurance at project level with Project Manager<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Enforces all aspects of site safety<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Minimum Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor s Degree in Engineering or Construction Management from an accredited institution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 10 years experience in project management within a construction or engineering firm<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years engineering experience involving marine works, such as island expansion\u002Frehabilitation, dredging, diking, rock placement, etc<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Preferred:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Knowledge and experience of specific construction processes including operations and functional performance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with Primavera P6 Scheduling or other software packages typically associated with construction and engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)<\u002Fli>\n Dit wil zeggen dat onze contracten in gebouwen als ziekenhuizen, kantoorgebouwen, industrieën, scholen, gevangenissen, enzovoort zijn.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Hier streven wij naar een vijfsterren klanten service in de HVAC Sector.<\u002Fp>\n <p> TAKEN<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Een HVAC technieker staat in voor het preventief onderhoud, de technische interventies en de herstellingen van HVAC installaties.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Niet afgeschrikt om materiaal te bestellen voor dringende interventies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Iemand met een brede kennis om verschillende soorten reparaties uit te voeren.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Communicatief sterk met de klanten en je rapporteert dagelijks aan je leidinggevende.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Je hebt oog voor opportuniteiten bij de klanten en informeert je leidinggevende hierover.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Een gedetailleerd rapport opmaken van jouw interventies schrikt jou niet af.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Iemand die de regels rond veiligheid respecteert en volgt.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Opleiding : Bachelor in klimatisatie of gelijkwaardig door ervaring.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Ervaring : 5 jaar ervaring.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Technische vaardigheden : HVAC.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Pluspunten:<\u002Fp>\n <p> In het bezit van een van deze certificaten is een pluspunt:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> GI<\u002Fli>\n  <li> GII<\u002Fli>\n  <li> CEDICOL<\u002Fli>\n  <li> CERGA<\u002Fli>\n  <li> L<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Koelcertificaat cat. 1<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Koelcertificaat cat. 4<\u002Fli>\n  <li> VCA<\u002Fli>\n  <li> BA5<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Talen : Nederlands.<\u002Fp>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> VINCI Energies biedt u een professionele omgeving waar u de mogelijkheid krijgt om een heel interessant werk te leveren en verder te bouwen aan uw carrière. <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As the Technical Lead for Roadway &amp; Civil on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will be responsible for providing technical and managerial support to the construction operations on the project related to roadway structures (retaining walls and the related ground improvements, sound walls, etc.).<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Flatiron, Dragados USA and VINCI has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Lead project meetings to collect and disseminate information pertaining to the project<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible for technical specifications\u002Fdrawings review and issue resolution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate the collection and dissemination of technical information between\u002Fwithin the company and the owner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible to develop\u002Freviewing Work Plans and Procedures that enable to start Construction on-site and getting approvals from the EOR and the owner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible for RFIs \u002F FDCs related to the design as well as NCR resolution \u002F corrective action approval from the EOR and the owner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Schedule and monitor program activity to achieve an on-time result including follow-up with external suppliers to ensure timely response to action items<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create a bill of materials, referencing project drawings and specifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review quotations utilizing supplier information, cost standards, technical information from quality, manufacturing, engineering, and design<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Determines the possibility of conflicts\u002Fdelays in the construction process by reviewing project drawings. Analyzes the process to determine the likelihood of detection and resulting effect. Suggests preventative steps for correction<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that project charges are correctly represented for accounting s closing process<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluate that project charges are correctly represented for accounting s closing process<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manages subcontractors and changes orders on the project<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Executes additional duties and responsibilities as assigned<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Schedules Quality Control &amp; Quality Assurance inspections<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates survey operations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provides support for company initiatives<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> R<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><b><i>equired:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or Construction Management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 7 years experience within a construction or engineering firm, focused on technical elements of heavy civil roadway design\u002Fconstruction<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i>Preferred:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering or Construction Management from an accredited institution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Professional Engineer License <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Field experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge and experience with Word, Excel, and PowerPoint<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge with Primavera P6 Scheduling Software is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communication – excellent oral presentation and written skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Goal-oriented – able to set goals and achieve them<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong follow-up ability with vendors and subcontractors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interpersonal – able to work well and persuade people at all organization levels<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Organizational ability – able to plan, prioritize, organize and monitor activities and projects. <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Project Engineer for civil works business development at the agency of VINCI Construction LLC based in Alexandria, Virginia, you will work in identifying and developing the commercial opportunities for prospective projects and you will participate in bid preparation and submission.<\u002Fp> \n <p> VINCI Construction LLC is a subsidiary of VINCI Construction Grands Projets, with its main office located in Alexandria, Virginia. VINCI Construction Grands Projets is the design-build contractor of the VINCI Group s Major Project Division. The VINCI Group is a global concession-and-construction player, generating 49BN revenue with more than 100 years of experience in delivering major infrastructure projects and project-management capabilities to design and build major civil engineering structures worldwide. The VINCI Group was ranked 4th in the Engineering News-Record (ENR) 2019 Top 250 International Contractors.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Currently, VINCI Construction Grands Projets is involved on the Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel, a $3.3BN Design-Build project – the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i>***Please include a cover letter with you resume***<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Participate in call for bids: participate, together with the engineer in charge of the business development for the US sector, the Bid Manager and his\u002Fher associated team, in the preparation of qualification-based submission, technical and financial proposal (can consist of searching best fitting VINCI s references to meet Client s criteria, technical or commercial writing and reviewing, helping in collecting the required administrative documents, identifying and suggesting improvement during documents review, coordinating with the head office and\u002For partners for follow-up of your scope of works, assisting, as part of the Bid team, in providing input for Proposal preparation such as a request for clarifications, technical, scheduling, risk elements, materials, equipment, estimating, review of existing standards, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in the project early identification: Monitor early development of new projects (internet, magazine, client s public meeting, etc.), identify relevant projects targeted by the company, and prepare a presentation for the selection committee (summarizing main information about contract type, cost estimate, timeline, technical main points, etc.), update accordingly the different corporate databases for commercial reporting<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in supporting missions inherent to the agency background operations: Sharepoint\u002FTeams updates, monitoring potential change in regulation applicable to our scope of works, update technical or commercial presentation ahead of Client or Partner meeting<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform additional assignments per management s direction<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> Required:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Senior Geotechnical Engineer on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will assist the Geotechnical Lead with various duties such as supporting design and construction by carrying out testing and analysis to assess risk and the environment. The Geotechnical Engineer will provide geotechnical modeling, analysis &amp; design, and technical project management.<br> <br> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of VINCI Construction, Dragados, and Flatiron has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <br> <br> The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li><p>As discipline expert, lead the overall oversight of design joint ventures geotechnical design and constructability challenges for the project. This includes, but is not limited to: oversight on all geotechnical temporary and permanent works design, quality of engineering solutions and deliverables, and coordination of design throughout design development and construction<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Define the geotechnical assumptions for the temporary works, providing project engineering expertise, including but not limited to: preparation of design criteria and basis, and performing specialized engineering, analysis, and designs<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead taskforce meetings and perform interdisciplinary peer\u002Fconstructability review of design deliverables for optimization compliance with contract documents, and identification and implementation of new technologies that provide unique solutions to complex technical issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure the consistency of the geotechnical approach over the whole project<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide engineering recommendations and decisions within the criteria set by the Design and Engineering department on the projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support design coordination and liaise with Clients and Subcontractors, acting as discipline experts in interfacing with specialized sub-consultants<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> geotechnical, structural, bridge, roadway, pavement, drainage<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Active Professional Engineer (PE or PENG) license<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Strongly <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Superintendent for Roadway Structures on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will schedule, coordinate and supervise production and workforce engaged in your assigned area of the project. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Dragados, Flatiron, and VINCI has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Supervises assigned project work across roadway structures and liaises between field engineering, estimating, and craft workforce to ensure project compliance with contract drawings and specifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plans work methods, materials, equipment needs and work schedule for assigned project work. Reviews daily work schedule with direct reports and provide input for weekly\u002Fmonthly schedule updates based on project feedback<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews and understands the project specifications to support job set up activities; works with crews, field engineers, and project stakeholders to identify hazardous areas on job site<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participates in look ahead schedule development and adherence for work activities and presents production work plan during project meetings to ensure all project crews and leaders are in alignment <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinates with internal equipment team and external vendors to ensure that project is equipped with appropriate equipment and material quantities to complete production within assigned budget and schedule<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provides technical input to identify and resolve project risks including construction methods, work plan, and material requirements, safety, and schedule activities. Documents daily activities and meeting notes using Company approved document methods<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates with internal and external departments to ensure all mandated inspections are completed within requested timeframes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Supports and promotes strict adherence to safety and process controls regarding operating equipment, worksite safety, and documentation requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Supervises sub-contractor production and workforce regarding assigned project work. Recommends work schedule or work method adjustments regarding sub-contractor activities, as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates project close-out activities in line with project standards and Owner checklist requirements<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Performs additional assignments per management s direction<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> R<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><b><i>equired:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum 8 years of heavy civil construction experience with at least five years experience managing crews in the field on heavy structures <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Valid Driver s License<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong written, verbal, and presentation communication skills required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong leadership capability with an internal drive to mentor and grow internal talent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advanced knowledge of construction site equipment operation and maintenance requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advanced knowledge of construction site safety protocols and proven ability to enforce project safety programs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to read, analyze, and interpret standards and contract-specific plans and specifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistics, and fundamentals geometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Strongly Encouraged:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Previous experience in the US<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Crane lift supervisor experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Specialty\u002Fexperience in foundations, substructure, superstructure, or closely related areas <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Safety Trained Supervisor <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Civil Drainage Design Coordinator on the $3.3BN Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel Expansion Project (HRBT) in Virginia, you will help manage design coordination of the Landside Civil Works – Primarily Underground, Stormwater management, and Drainage design scope.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Hampton Roads Connector Partners JV (HRCP) consisting of Dragados, Flatiron, and VINCI has been selected to construct the $3.3BN Design-Build project –the largest civil construction contract ever awarded by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). <\u002Fp>\n <p>The project scope across a 9-mile section of the I-64 will include a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45 diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second-largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. The project is expected to continue to the end of 2025. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Assist coordination of all underground civil roadway works offering design coordination and technical support to construction operations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge and understanding of Water Quality, Stormwater (including Water Quality), Erosion and Sediment Control, Highways and Urban Roads<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide technical design coordination expertise for drainage and stormwater quality systems, including piped networks and major transverse drainage structures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiar with roadway stormwater drainage, stormwater structures, retention, and other related analysis including environmental impacts and credits<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work in collaboration with other design disciplines to ensure the integrity of the overall design and interfaces are well managed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure the full integration of the different disciplines of the designer is done correctly so no clash will be detected during the execution phase<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Helping to gain approval of construction drawings and specifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Helping to maintain construction drawings and specification files<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contribute to the delivery of drainage post designs on the project; Assist in controlling the quantity growth of this area<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitoring designer on post-design related elements in this area<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i>
